content: MILAN, May 3 (Reuters) - Italy's Enel CEO Francesco Starace has no intention to remain for a further term, the top manager said in a statement on Wednesday amid tensions ahead of a May 10 shareholders meeting due to a vote on a new board of directors.

In order to preserve the group's neutrality with respect to upcoming appointments, the board has banned interviews, statements, or any communication on the subject until May 10, the statement added. (Reporting by Francesca Landini Editing by Chris Reese)
